etymologies: Old English scilling, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch schelling and German Schilling

definitions: a former British coin and monetary unit equal to one twentieth of a pound or twelve pence.
shortDefinitions: former British coin and monetary unit equal to one twentieth of pound or twelve pence

definitions: the basic monetary unit in Kenya, Tanzania, and Uganda, equal to 100 cents.
shortDefinitions: basic monetary unit in Kenya, Tanzania, and Uganda, equal to 100 cents
